title: WordPress Setup and Core Infrastructure
details: Install WordPress on Linux-based hosting with PHP 8.0+ and MySQL. Configure HTTPS with SSL certificate, implement security hardening (disable file editing, limit login attempts, secure wp-config.php). Set up staging and production environments. Configure DNS management and ensure 99.9% uptime SLA. Install essential plugins for security, performance optimization, and form handling. Create custom post types for news, committee members, and program events. Set up automated backups and monitoring.

subtasks.title: Set up hosting environment and WordPress installation
subtasks.details: Provision hosting server with Linux OS, install Apache/Nginx web server, PHP 8.0+ with required extensions (mysqli, gd, curl, zip), MySQL 8.0+. Download latest WordPress version, create database and user with appropriate privileges, configure wp-config.php with database credentials and security keys. Set proper file permissions (644 for files, 755 for directories) and ownership. Configure PHP settings for memory limit, upload size, and execution time.
subtasks.description: Configure Linux-based hosting environment with PHP 8.0+, MySQL database, and install WordPress core files with proper file permissions and directory structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify WordPress installation by accessing admin dashboard, test database connectivity, validate PHP version and extensions, check file permissions and ownership

subtasks.title: Configure domain, DNS, and SSL certificate
subtasks.details: Configure DNS A records to point domain to hosting server IP address. Obtain and install SSL certificate (Let's Encrypt or commercial). Configure web server to redirect HTTP to HTTPS automatically. Update WordPress site URL and home URL to use HTTPS. Implement security headers (HSTS, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options) in web server configuration. Set up DNS management system for future changes.
subtasks.description: Set up domain configuration, DNS management, and implement SSL certificate for HTTPS encryption with proper redirects and security headers.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify SSL certificate validity and chain, test HTTPS redirect functionality, validate security headers using online tools, confirm DNS propagation

subtasks.title: Implement WordPress security hardening
subtasks.details: Secure wp-config.php by moving outside web root or setting proper permissions. Disable file editing in WordPress admin by adding define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true). Install and configure security plugin (Wordfence or similar) for firewall, malware scanning, and login attempt limiting. Change default admin username, enforce strong passwords, enable two-factor authentication. Hide WordPress version, disable XML-RPC if not needed, remove unnecessary plugins and themes. Configure fail2ban for additional brute force protection.
subtasks.description: Apply comprehensive security measures including wp-config.php hardening, login protection, file editing restrictions, and security plugin configuration.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test login attempt limiting functionality, verify file editing is disabled in admin, scan for common vulnerabilities, validate security plugin configuration

subtasks.title: Set up staging environment and essential plugins
subtasks.details: Set up staging subdomain or directory with separate WordPress installation and database. Install essential plugins: security plugin (Wordfence), caching plugin (WP Rocket or W3 Total Cache), contact form plugin (Contact Form 7 or Gravity Forms), SEO plugin (Yoast), backup plugin (UpdraftPlus). Configure performance optimization settings including caching, image compression, and CDN if applicable. Set up plugin update notifications and staging-to-production deployment workflow.
subtasks.description: Create staging environment for testing, install and configure essential plugins for security, performance, forms, and content management functionality.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify staging environment functionality, test all installed plugins, validate caching performance, test form submission and email delivery

subtasks.title: Create custom post types and implement monitoring with backups
subtasks.details: Create custom post types using functions.php or Custom Post Type UI plugin for news articles, committee member profiles, and program events with appropriate custom fields and taxonomies. Configure automated daily backups to remote storage (cloud storage like AWS S3 or Google Drive). Set up uptime monitoring service to ensure 99.9% SLA compliance. Implement log monitoring for errors and security events. Configure email notifications for backup status, security alerts, and uptime issues. Document backup restoration procedures.
subtasks.description: Develop custom post types for CIL2026 content (news, committee members, program events), configure automated backups, and set up monitoring systems.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test custom post type creation and editing, verify automated backup functionality and restoration process, validate monitoring alerts and uptime tracking

description: Set up WordPress CMS with secure hosting, domain configuration, SSL certificate, and basic security hardening for the CIL2026 website foundation.
testStrategy: Verify SSL certificate installation, test WordPress admin access, validate security headers, perform load testing for concurrent users, test backup and restore procedures.

title: Responsive Frontend Development and Public Pages
details: Create custom WordPress theme with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Implement mobile-first responsive design for desktop, tablet, and mobile. Build hero banner with logo, countdown timer, and CTAs. Develop partner logos carousel, interactive program timeline with chronological bar, Google Maps integration for venue location. Ensure page load times under 2 seconds with optimized images and assets. Implement semantic markup for accessibility with alt text and proper heading structure. Create custom fields in WordPress for easy content management by non-technical users.

subtasks.title: Create WordPress Theme Foundation and Base Structure
subtasks.details: Create theme directory structure with style.css, index.php, functions.php, header.php, footer.php. Implement HTML5 semantic elements (header, nav, main, section, article, aside, footer). Set up CSS3 mobile-first media queries framework with breakpoints for mobile (320px+), tablet (768px+), and desktop (1024px+). Initialize JavaScript modules for interactive components. Configure WordPress theme support for menus, post thumbnails, and custom fields.
subtasks.description: Establish the core WordPress theme architecture with HTML5 semantic structure, mobile-first CSS3 framework, and JavaScript foundation. Set up the theme files, functions.php, and basic template hierarchy.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate HTML5 markup, test CSS framework across different screen sizes, verify WordPress theme activation and basic functionality

subtasks.title: Develop Home Page with Hero Banner and Interactive Elements
subtasks.details: Create hero section with conference logo, event date countdown timer using JavaScript, prominent registration and call-for-papers CTAs. Develop partner logos carousel with smooth transitions and touch/swipe support for mobile. Implement lazy loading for images, optimize asset delivery with minification and compression. Use CSS Grid and Flexbox for responsive layouts. Ensure hero banner scales properly across all device sizes with appropriate typography scaling.
subtasks.description: Build the main landing page featuring hero banner with logo, countdown timer, call-to-action buttons, and partner logos carousel. Implement responsive design and performance optimization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test countdown timer accuracy, verify carousel functionality on touch devices, measure page load speed with PageSpeed Insights, validate responsive behavior across screen sizes

subtasks.title: Build Core Content Pages with Custom WordPress Fields
subtasks.details: Create custom page templates for each content type. Implement Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) or native WordPress custom fields for committee member profiles, submission guidelines, venue information, and contact details. Build flexible content blocks for rich text, images, and structured data. Ensure consistent typography, spacing, and responsive behavior across all pages. Create user-friendly admin interface with clear field labels and help text for content editors.
subtasks.description: Develop Presentation & Context, Call for Papers, Committees, and Practical Info pages with custom WordPress fields for easy content management by non-technical users.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test custom field functionality in WordPress admin, verify content display across different page templates, validate responsive design on all content pages

subtasks.title: Implement Program Page with Interactive Timeline and Google Maps
subtasks.details: Build interactive program timeline using CSS3 animations and JavaScript, with chronological navigation bar for easy date/session jumping. Implement expandable session details with speaker information and abstracts. Integrate Google Maps API for venue location with custom markers and responsive map sizing. Add venue details overlay with address, directions, and contact information. Ensure timeline is touch-friendly and accessible with keyboard navigation support.
subtasks.description: Create the conference program page featuring an interactive timeline with chronological navigation bar and integrate Google Maps for venue location display.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test timeline interactivity and navigation, verify Google Maps integration and responsiveness, validate accessibility with keyboard navigation, test on various devices

subtasks.title: Implement Registration & Fees Page and Conduct Comprehensive Testing
subtasks.details: Create registration page with clear fee structure tables, early bird pricing displays, and registration process steps. Implement responsive pricing tables that work well on mobile devices. Conduct comprehensive testing including cross-browser compatibility (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge), responsive design validation on multiple screen sizes, accessibility testing with WAVE tool for WCAG compliance, and performance optimization to achieve sub-2-second load times. Fix any issues identified during testing phase.
subtasks.description: Develop the registration and fees page with clear pricing structure and registration process information, then perform comprehensive cross-browser, accessibility, and performance testing across all pages.
subtasks.testStrategy: Cross-browser testing on major browsers, responsive design testing on various screen sizes, performance testing with PageSpeed Insights targeting sub-2-second load times, accessibility testing with WAVE tool, user acceptance testing for navigation and usability

description: Develop all public-facing pages with responsive design including Home, Presentation & Context, Call for Papers, Program, Registration & Fees, Committees, and Practical Info pages.
testStrategy: Cross-browser testing on major browsers, responsive design testing on various screen sizes, performance testing with PageSpeed Insights, accessibility testing with WAVE tool, user acceptance testing for navigation and usability.

title: Forms Development and Email Automation
details: Create paper submission form with fields for name, affiliation, email, document type selector, and secure file upload with validation. Build registration form with personal data fields, status dropdown with automatic fee calculation, workshop options, and payment method selection. Implement CAPTCHA or honeypot fields for spam protection. Set up SMTP transactional email service (SendGrid or Mailgun) with SPF/DKIM configuration. Create automated email templates for confirmations and deadline reminders. Implement form validation and sanitization for security. Store submissions securely and forward via email to organizers.

subtasks.title: Create Paper Submission Form with File Upload
subtasks.details: Build HTML form with input fields for personal information, dropdown for document types (abstract, full paper, poster), and file upload component. Implement client-side validation for required fields, email format, and file type/size restrictions. Add server-side validation and sanitization for all inputs. Configure secure file upload with virus scanning, file type whitelist (PDF, DOC, DOCX), and size limits (max 10MB). Store uploaded files in secure directory outside web root with unique naming convention.
subtasks.description: Develop a comprehensive paper submission form with all required fields including name, affiliation, email, document type selector, and secure file upload functionality with proper validation and security measures.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test form validation with various input scenarios including malicious inputs, verify file upload security with different file types and sizes, test XSS prevention and SQL injection protection

subtasks.title: Build Registration Form with Fee Calculation
subtasks.details: Design form with fields for personal information, academic/professional status dropdown (student, faculty, industry), workshop checkboxes with descriptions. Implement JavaScript for real-time fee calculation based on status and selected workshops. Add payment method selection (credit card, bank transfer, PayPal). Include terms and conditions checkbox. Implement form validation for all fields and payment information. Store registration data securely in database with encrypted sensitive information.
subtasks.description: Create a registration form with personal data fields, status dropdown with automatic fee calculation, workshop selection options, and payment method integration.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test fee calculation accuracy with different combinations, validate payment method integration, test form submission with various user scenarios

subtasks.title: Implement Spam Protection and Security Measures
subtasks.details: Integrate Google reCAPTCHA v3 or implement honeypot fields (hidden form fields that bots typically fill). Add CSRF tokens to all forms. Implement rate limiting to prevent form spam (max 5 submissions per IP per hour). Sanitize all user inputs using appropriate libraries (HTMLPurifier for rich text, filter_var for emails). Add server-side validation that mirrors client-side validation. Implement session-based form tokens to prevent replay attacks.
subtasks.description: Add CAPTCHA or honeypot fields to both forms for spam protection and implement comprehensive security measures including input sanitization and CSRF protection.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test CAPTCHA functionality, verify honeypot effectiveness against bots, test rate limiting with automated submissions, validate CSRF protection

subtasks.title: Configure SMTP Email Service and Templates
subtasks.details: Configure SendGrid or Mailgun SMTP service with API keys and authentication. Set up SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records in DNS for email deliverability. Create responsive HTML email templates for: submission confirmation, registration confirmation, payment receipt, deadline reminders. Implement email template engine with dynamic content insertion (user name, submission details, deadlines). Configure email sending queue system for reliability. Set up email logging and bounce handling.
subtasks.description: Set up transactional email service with proper authentication and create automated email templates for confirmations and communications.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test email deliverability to various providers (Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo), verify emails don't go to spam folder, test template rendering across email clients

subtasks.title: Implement Automated Email System and Data Management
subtasks.details: Implement automated email sending upon form submission using email templates. Create cron job system for deadline reminders (7 days, 3 days, 1 day before deadlines). Set up database tables for storing submissions with proper indexing and encryption for sensitive data. Implement email forwarding system to notify organizers of new submissions with submission summary (without sensitive payment info). Create admin dashboard for viewing submissions and managing email campaigns. Implement backup system for form data and uploaded files.
subtasks.description: Create automated email confirmation system, deadline reminder scheduling, and secure data storage with email forwarding to organizers.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test automated email triggers, verify reminder scheduling accuracy, validate data storage security, test email forwarding to organizers, test system under load conditions

description: Implement paper submission and registration forms with file upload capabilities, automated email confirmations, and deadline reminder system.
testStrategy: Test form validation with various input scenarios, verify file upload security and size limits, test email deliverability and spam folder placement, validate automated reminder scheduling, test form submission under load.

title: Payment Integration and Downloads Management
details: Research and integrate Mobile Money APIs available in Gabon and credit card processing options. Create payment instruction pages with clear guidance for each method. Display bank transfer details securely. Implement secure download system for Call for Papers PDF and Word templates without requiring user accounts. Create centralized downloads section with proper file management. Set up payment confirmation workflows and integrate with registration system. Ensure GDPR compliance for payment data handling and provide fallback options for payment gateway limitations.

subtasks.title: Research and integrate Mobile Money and credit card payment gateways
subtasks.details: Identify major Mobile Money providers in Gabon and their API documentation. Research credit card processors like Stripe, PayPal, or local alternatives. Set up developer accounts and sandbox environments. Implement payment gateway SDKs with proper error handling, webhook processing, and transaction status tracking. Create payment gateway abstraction layer for easy switching between providers.
subtasks.description: Research available Mobile Money APIs in Gabon (such as Airtel Money, Moov Money) and international credit card processors. Integrate chosen payment gateways with sandbox testing and implement secure payment processing workflows.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test all payment methods in sandbox mode with various transaction scenarios including successful payments, failures, and timeouts

subtasks.title: Create payment instruction pages and bank transfer information display
subtasks.details: Create responsive payment instruction templates with visual guides and screenshots. Implement secure display of bank account details with copy-to-clipboard functionality. Add multi-language support for payment instructions. Include estimated processing times and troubleshooting sections. Implement dynamic content management for updating payment instructions without code changes.
subtasks.description: Design and implement user-friendly payment instruction pages for each payment method, including clear step-by-step guidance for Mobile Money, credit cards, and bank transfers. Display bank transfer details securely with proper formatting.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct user testing sessions to validate instruction clarity and gather feedback on payment flow usability

subtasks.title: Implement secure document download system
subtasks.details: Set up secure file storage with access token generation for temporary download links. Implement file integrity verification using checksums. Create download tracking system with rate limiting to prevent abuse. Add virus scanning for uploaded templates. Implement secure file serving with proper headers and content-type validation. Set up automated cleanup of temporary download tokens.
subtasks.description: Create a secure download system for Call for Papers PDF and Word templates that works without user accounts. Implement proper access controls, file integrity checks, and download tracking while maintaining security.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test download security by attempting unauthorized access, verify file integrity checks, and validate rate limiting functionality

subtasks.title: Create centralized downloads section with file management
subtasks.details: Design responsive downloads interface with category filtering and search functionality. Implement administrative panel for file upload, organization, and version control. Add file metadata management including descriptions, upload dates, and file sizes. Create automated file organization with folder structures. Implement download analytics and popular downloads tracking. Add file preview capabilities where applicable.
subtasks.description: Build a centralized downloads section that organizes all conference documents, templates, and resources with proper categorization, search functionality, and administrative file management capabilities.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test file management workflows, verify search and filtering functionality, and validate administrative controls

subtasks.title: Set up payment confirmation workflows and GDPR compliance
subtasks.details: Create automated email confirmation system for successful payments with receipt generation. Implement payment status tracking and integration with user registration records. Set up GDPR-compliant data handling with encryption, data retention policies, and user consent management. Create fallback payment options for gateway failures. Implement payment reconciliation system for administrative oversight. Add dispute resolution workflows and refund processing capabilities.
subtasks.description: Implement payment confirmation workflows that integrate with the registration system, ensure GDPR compliance for payment data handling, and create fallback options for payment gateway limitations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate GDPR compliance measures, test payment confirmation workflows end-to-end, and verify fallback payment options functionality

description: Integrate payment gateway guidance for Mobile Money and credit cards, implement secure document downloads, and set up bank transfer information display.
testStrategy: Test payment gateway integrations in sandbox mode, verify download security and access controls, test payment instruction clarity with user feedback, validate GDPR compliance measures, test payment confirmation workflows.

title: Admin CMS Configuration and Final Security Implementation
details: Set up WordPress admin with custom fields and WYSIWYG editors for news, program updates, deadlines, fees, and committee management. Restrict styling options to prevent layout breaking. Implement user role management for organizers. Add GDPR-compliant privacy notices and data protection measures. Configure data encryption in transit and at rest. Set up comprehensive input validation and sanitization. Implement final security hardening measures. Create admin documentation and training materials. Perform final security audit and penetration testing. Set up monitoring and analytics for basic traffic stats.

subtasks.title: Configure WordPress Admin CMS with Custom Fields and User Roles
subtasks.details: Create custom post types using Advanced Custom Fields (ACF) or similar plugin. Configure WYSIWYG editors with limited toolbar options to prevent layout breaking. Set up custom user roles with appropriate capabilities for organizers. Create custom admin interface sections for each content type with proper field validation and user-friendly layouts.
subtasks.description: Set up WordPress admin area with custom post types and fields for news, program updates, deadlines, fees, and committee management. Implement WYSIWYG editors with restricted styling options and configure user role management for organizers.
subtasks.testStrategy: User acceptance testing with organizers to validate CMS functionality and workflow efficiency

subtasks.title: Implement GDPR Compliance and Privacy Protection Measures
subtasks.details: Implement cookie consent banner with granular controls. Create privacy policy and terms of service pages. Add data export and deletion functionality for user requests. Implement data retention policies and automated cleanup processes. Configure audit logging for data access and modifications. Add consent tracking and management system.
subtasks.description: Add GDPR-compliant privacy notices, cookie consent mechanisms, data protection measures, and user data management features to ensure legal compliance with European data protection regulations.
subtasks.testStrategy: GDPR compliance audit and legal review of privacy implementation

subtasks.title: Configure Data Encryption and Input Validation Security
subtasks.details: Configure SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission. Implement database encryption for sensitive data fields. Add comprehensive input validation using WordPress nonces and sanitization functions. Implement CSRF protection and XSS prevention measures. Configure secure file upload handling with type validation and virus scanning. Add rate limiting for form submissions.
subtasks.description: Implement comprehensive data encryption for data in transit and at rest, along with robust input validation and sanitization across all user inputs and admin interfaces.
subtasks.testStrategy: Security penetration testing and automated vulnerability scanning

subtasks.title: Implement Final Security Hardening and Monitoring
subtasks.details: Configure WordPress security plugins (Wordfence or similar). Implement file integrity monitoring and malware scanning. Set up Google Analytics or similar for traffic monitoring. Configure security headers (HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options). Implement login attempt monitoring and IP blocking. Set up automated security updates and backup systems. Configure server-level security measures and firewall rules.
subtasks.description: Apply comprehensive security hardening measures, set up monitoring systems, analytics for traffic stats, and implement intrusion detection and prevention systems.
subtasks.testStrategy: Performance testing under expected load and continuous security monitoring validation

subtasks.title: Create Documentation and Perform Final Testing
subtasks.details: Create step-by-step admin user guides with screenshots. Develop video tutorials for complex workflows. Write technical documentation for maintenance procedures. Conduct comprehensive penetration testing and security audit. Perform cross-browser and device compatibility testing. Execute final user acceptance testing with organizers. Create incident response procedures and emergency contact protocols.
subtasks.description: Develop comprehensive admin documentation and training materials, then conduct final security audit, penetration testing, and cross-browser compatibility testing to ensure system readiness.
subtasks.testStrategy: Final cross-browser and device testing, admin workflow testing, and comprehensive security audit

description: Configure WordPress admin area for organizers with custom fields, implement final security measures, GDPR compliance, and perform comprehensive testing.
testStrategy: User acceptance testing with organizers for CMS functionality, security penetration testing, GDPR compliance audit, performance testing under expected load, final cross-browser and device testing, admin workflow testing.
